intro: Hymenothrix pedata, commonly known as the creeping liverwort, is a non-vascular plant belonging to the family Pinnulariaceae. It is characterized by its prostrate growth habit, with leafy shoots forming dense mats on moist, shaded surfaces. The plant has a distinctive thalloid structure, with a central axis and leaf-like structures arranged in two rows. Hymenothrix pedata thrives in humid environments, often found in forest floors or along rocky outcrops. Its reproductive structures, known as sorocarps, contain spores that are released when mature, facilitating its propagation in suitable habitats.
